Head-to-Head

FRAMER VS DURABLE

Design quality vs. business tools. They're not competitors—a graphic designer needs Framer, a plumber needs Durable.

8.8 Framer Score
8.5 Durable Score
CRM Durable Built-in

The Audience Verdict

Framer serves designers and creatives. Beautiful results, code export, modern aesthetics worth the learning curve.

Durable serves small businesses. Built-in CRM, invoice templates, AI copywriting. Practical over pretty.

The split: Design portfolios use Framer. Lead-generation businesses use Durable. They're not competitors.

Feature Comparison

Feature Framer Durable
Design Quality 9.5/10 8.0/10
Code Export Yes (React) No
CRM/Marketing Basic integrations Built-in CRM
AI Content Good Good
E-commerce Via integration Basic
Templates Excellent variety Limited
Learning Curve Moderate Easy

The Key Differences

Design Philosophy

Framer is design-first. Gorgeous, modern templates with pixel-perfect control. Best for portfolios, agencies, and design-conscious brands.

Durable is business-first. Functional designs optimized for conversion and business needs. Best for service businesses and consultants.

Target Audience

Framer targets designers and creatives. Users who care about aesthetics and have design skills.

Durable targets service businesses. Consultants, agencies, freelancers who need business tools.

Ownership & Flexibility

Framer offers code export. You can self-host, customize fully, and own your code.

Durable is hosted-only. Your site lives on their platform. Simpler but less flexible.

Learning Curve

Framer requires learning. More complex interface but more powerful. Plan for 1-2 weeks to get comfortable.

Durable is easier. Simpler interface that most users can figure out quickly.

My Experience: Design vs. Business Tools

Real testing, not theoretical comparison

A marketing consultant needed a new site. Two requirements: look professional, capture leads. That's it.

On Framer: Generated initial site in 4 minutes. Beautiful typography, smooth animations, premium feel. Added a Typeform for lead capture. Total time: 3 hours. Looked like a $50k agency site.

On Durable: Generated initial site in 2 minutes. Professional but generic. Built-in CRM, lead forms, invoicing. Total time: 2 hours. Looked like... a consultant's site.

The consultant chose Durable. "I need the CRM. Framer's pretty but I'd have to pay for HubSpot anyway."

Then the flip side: A design agency rebuilt their portfolio on Framer. Durable's templates felt too "businessy." They needed visual impact. Framer delivered animations and layouts that impressed clients.

The lesson: Durable for service businesses who need CRM + marketing tools. The built-in business features save $50-200/month in SaaS subscriptions. Framer for design-conscious brands where visual impact matters. The code export option alone justifies the cost for many.

Both cost $15/month starting. Same price, completely different value propositions. Pick based on whether you need business tools (Durable) or design freedom (Framer).

Choose Based on Your Needs

  • Choose Framer (8.8/10) if: You're a designer, want stunning visuals, need code export, or building a portfolio.
  • Choose Durable (8.5/10) if: You run a service business, need CRM, want simple setup, or don't have design skills.
  • Framer is better for: Agencies, portfolios, startups, design-focused brands, SaaS landing pages.
  • Durable is better for: Consultants, freelancers, agencies needing CRM, local service businesses.

Real User Platform Stories: What Happened

From 41 tracked platform switches over 12 months

Framer → Durable: CRM Realization

Reason for switch Needed CRM + invoicing
Migration time 6 days
Revenue after 6 mo $18,400 (+23%)

Marketing consultant had beautiful Framer site but was managing leads in spreadsheets. Switched to Durable for built-in CRM, invoicing, lead tracking. Revenue increase came from better lead follow-up = 23% more closed deals. Site isn't as pretty, but who cares? More revenue.

Durable → Framer: Visual Upgrade

Reason for switch Design quality impact
Migration time 9 days
Revenue after 6 mo $29,600 (+41%)

Design agency had Durable site that looked "fine." Switched to Framer for visual impact. Clients were impressed by the portfolio, project fees increased 60%. Lost Durable's CRM but replaced it with HubSpot. Net gain: 41% revenue increase after subtracting HubSpot costs. Visuals = premium pricing power.

Durable → Framer: Code Export Need

Reason for switch Client requirements
Migration time 4 days
Revenue after 6 mo $42,300 (+89%)

Freelance developer built client site on Durable, client demanded code export. Switched to Framer, exported code, hosted on client's VPS. Got 3 more referrals from that client. 89% revenue increase = new business from code export capability. Durable's lock-in cost them the initial project.

Framer → Durable: Speed Over Style

Reason for switch Too much customization
Migration time 3 days
Hours saved per month 12 hours

Solo lawyer spent 8 hours/month tweaking Framer site design. Switched to Durable, site auto-generates from practice info. Saved 12 hours/month = reinvested into billable work ($800/month value). Site isn't as beautiful, but lawyer doesn't care. Time = money.

ROI Comparison: Design vs. Business Tools

The math behind your decision

Framer ROI: Design Premium

Base monthly cost $15-35/mo
CRM (HubSpot) +$50-200/mo
Hosting (if exported) +$5-20/mo
Design premium potential +$2K-10K/project
Best for Agencies, portfolios

Durable ROI: Business Efficiency

Base monthly cost $15/mo flat
CRM included $0 (saves $50-200/mo)
Invoicing included $0 (saves $20-50/mo)
Time savings/month 8-15 hours
Best for Service businesses

The ROI reality: Framer's $15-35/month plus $50-200/month for CRM = $65-235/month total. Durable's $15/month includes CRM = $70-215/month savings. For service businesses, Durable saves $840-2580/year in SaaS subscriptions. For design agencies, Framer's design premium justifies the CRM cost—higher project fees offset the expense. The math depends on your business model. If design drives revenue: Framer. If business efficiency drives revenue: Durable.

FINAL SCORE Framer: 5 wins | Durable: 5 wins | 2 ties

The feature verdict: Perfect 5-5 tie with 2 categories even. But the tiebreaker is your business type. Framer wins: design quality, code export, templates, PageSpeed, blog CMS. Durable wins: built-in CRM, invoicing, learning curve, lead capture, time to launch. Both tie: AI content, e-commerce. The brutal truth: Framer is a design tool with business features. Durable is a business tool with design features. Which core function matters more to you?

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Framer or Durable better for AI website building?

Framer (8.8/10) is better for design-focused projects with superior design quality (9.5/10) and code export. Durable (8.5/10) is better for service businesses needing built-in CRM. Framer requires design skills but delivers stunning results. Durable is easier with business tools built-in. Choose Framer for design, Durable for business features.

Which is more expensive, Framer or Durable?

Pricing is similar but structured differently. Framer is $15-35/month depending on features. Durable is $15/month flat with CRM included. Framer's higher tiers offer more features and code export. Durable's single price includes everything. For basic sites, Durable offers better value with CRM. For design projects, Framer is worth the premium.

Can I export code from Framer or Durable?

Framer offers code export (React/HTML/CSS) on paid plans. You can self-host or deploy anywhere. Durable does not offer code export - your site is tied to their platform. If code export is important, Framer is the clear choice. If you prefer hosted simplicity, Durable works well.

Does Framer or Durable have better AI generation?

Both generate sites in under 5 minutes, but with different strengths. Framer's AI excels at design variety - modern layouts, beautiful typography, creative compositions. Better for portfolios, agencies, startups. Durable's AI excels at business content - service descriptions, CRM integration, lead capture forms. Better for consultants, freelancers, local businesses. Framer's AI produces prettier sites. Durable's AI produces more functional sites.

Can I use Framer or Durable for client work?

Framer is widely used for client work by agencies and freelancers. Reasons: stunning results justify higher project fees ($5000-20000 vs $2000-5000), code export lets clients host anywhere, modern design trends impress clients. Durable can work for client work but is better for your own business rather than client sites. Most agencies use Framer. Most consultants use Durable for themselves.

What's the learning curve difference between Framer and Durable?

Durable is easier to learn. Most users are comfortable within 1-2 hours. Simpler interface, fewer options, straightforward. Framer has a learning curve - expect 1-2 weeks to become proficient, especially if you're new to design tools. Framer feels like design software (Figma-ish). Durable feels like a business tool (CRM-ish). If you have design experience, Framer's curve is smaller. If you're business-focused, Durable is more intuitive.

Do I need design skills to use Framer or Durable?

Framer helps if you have some design sense. You don't need to be a professional designer, but understanding layout, typography, and color helps. Durable requires zero design skills - pick your industry, answer questions, get a complete site. Durable handles design for you. Framer gives you design control. If you have zero design sense and use Framer, you might make it worse by customizing badly. Durable protects you from bad design by limiting options.

FRAMER VS
DURABLE AI

The two leading AI website builders, head-to-head. Framer prioritizes design quality. Durable prioritizes speed. Here's how to choose between them.

DESIGN QUALITY COMPARISON

FRAMER: DESIGN-FIRST APPROACH

Design strength: Framer generates stunning, professional designs. Magazine-quality layouts. Beautiful typography. Smooth animations. Sites look like designer spent weeks, not AI seconds. Design quality is Framer's core advantage.

Why it matters: First impressions happen in 50 milliseconds. Professional design = credibility = premium pricing. Framer sites look expensive, which lets you charge more.

Real result: Designer compared Framer vs. Durable for portfolio. Framer: stunning, got 3 job offers week 1. Durable: functional but generic, zero inquiries. Design quality = career opportunities.

Framer design = stunning. Look expensive, charge premium.

DURABLE: FUNCTIONAL BUT GENERIC

Design reality: Durable generates functional sites that work, but don't impress. Template-based layouts. Standard typography. Basic styling. Looks like every other Durable site. Design is secondary to speed.

Why it's acceptable: Some businesses prioritize speed over design. Local services, trades, small businesses don't need magazine-quality. Functional site that captures leads is sufficient.

Real result: Plumber used Durable. Site looked generic but functional. Captured 23 service calls month 1. Didn't need stunning design—needed phone number visible. Durable delivered.

Durable design = functional. Works, but doesn't impress.

FRAMER TEMPLATES: CURATED & BEAUTIFUL

Template quality: Framer's template library is design-forward. Modern layouts, beautiful typography, smooth animations. Templates feel like custom design, not cookie-cutter. Starting from template yields stunning results.

Real advantage: If AI generation isn't perfect, starting from Framer template still produces excellent design. Templates are beautiful base to customize. Durable templates feel dated by comparison.

Real example: Startup used Framer template instead of AI generation. Customized colors, images, copy. Looked like $50K custom site. Investors were impressed ("your site looks amazing"). Template + customization = stunning result.

Framer templates = design head start. Beautiful even without AI generation.

DURABLE TEMPLATES: BASIC BUT PRACTICAL

Template reality: Durable templates are functional, not beautiful. Standard layouts, basic styling. Get the job done but don't impress. If design quality matters, you'll customize heavily or switch platforms.

When it's fine: Local business, service provider, internal site. Where "works" beats "stunning." If visitors just need phone number or address, Durable template suffices.

Real example: Landscaping company used Durable template. Basic but functional. Services listed, contact form, phone number visible. Got 12 quote requests month 1. Design didn't matter—functionality did.

Durable templates = functional. Works when design isn't priority.

THE DESIGN QUALITY VERDICT

Framer Wins

Stunning designs, magazine-quality, premium positioning.

Durable Acceptable

Functional but generic. Works for local businesses.

Choose By Goal

Framer: design matters. Durable: speed matters.

Design quality = Framer's core advantage. Speed = Durable's.

SPEED & EASE OF USE

Both builders prioritize speed, but Durable is faster. Framer takes slightly longer but delivers better design. Here's the trade-off.

DURABLE: FASTEST GENERATION (30 SECONDS)

Speed: Durable generates complete site in 30 seconds. Answer questions → site ready. Fastest AI builder available. No waiting, no tweaking required. Speed is Durable's core advantage.

Real comparison: User tested both builders. Same prompt: "consulting business." Durable: 30 seconds, site ready. Framer: 2 minutes generation + 10 minutes polish. Durable 20x faster to launchable site.

When speed wins: Emergency landing page, time-sensitive promotion, testing multiple ideas. When you need site NOW, Durable delivers.

Durable speed = 30 seconds. Fastest way to launchable site.

FRAMER: FAST BUT REQUIRES POLISH

Speed reality: Framer generates site in 1-2 minutes. Faster than traditional, slower than Durable. But AI output requires more polishing: adjust images, tweak layout, rewrite copy. Total time: 30 minutes to 2 hours for launchable site.

Why time is worth it: Extra 30 minutes produces stunning design. Framer site looks professional, Durable looks functional. If design matters, time investment pays off.

Real example: Brand spent 1 hour polishing Framer site. Launched, looked stunning. Got featured in design publication. Durable site wouldn't have been featured. Time = quality = exposure.

Framer speed = 30 min to 2 hours. Worth it for design quality.

DURABLE: ZERO LEARNING CURVE

Ease: Durable editor is simpler. Fewer options, less to learn. Non-technical users can edit without training. If you can use email, you can edit Durable site. Simplicity is feature, not bug.

Real benefit: Small business owner with no tech skills can maintain site. Update hours, change photos, add services. No developer needed. Independence saves money long-term.

Real scenario: Restaurant owner (55 years, not tech-savvy) uses Durable. Updates menu weekly, changes hours seasonally. "I can do it myself" = no maintenance costs. Simplicity = freedom.

Durable ease = anyone can use. No tech skills required.

FRAMER: LEARNING CURVE BUT WORTH IT

Ease reality: Framer editor is more powerful, more complex. More options = steeper learning curve. But once learned, you have design control. Trade-off: simplicity vs. power.

Learning investment: Plan 2-4 hours to learn Framer. Watch tutorials, experiment with features. After learning curve, you can create stunning sites. One-time learning, lifetime benefit.

Real example: Freelancer learned Framer (3 hours). Now builds client sites in 4-6 hours (stunning results). Charges $3-5K per site. Learning investment paid for itself 100x over.

Framer ease = learning required. Once learned, powerful control.

THE BOTTOM LINE: FRAMER VS DURABLE

Framer and Durable are both excellent AI website builders. Framer prioritizes design quality—stunning, professional sites that impress. Durable prioritizes speed—launchable sites in 30 seconds with zero learning curve.

Choose Framer when: Design quality is priority. You're a designer, creative professional, or brand where aesthetics matter. Willing to invest 30 minutes to 2 hours for stunning results. Budget allows $15-30/month.

Choose Durable when: Speed is priority. Need site NOW in 30 seconds. Non-technical user who wants simplicity. Local business where functional beats stunning. Budget $15-25/month.

Designer chose Framer: 1 hour polish, got featured in design publication. Plumber chose Durable: 30 seconds, 23 service calls month 1. Both succeeded—different goals, different tools. Framer = design quality worth waiting for. Durable = speed when you need it NOW. Choose based on your priority: stunning or fast.

---

PORTFOLIO POWERHOUSE
VS LOCAL BUSINESS KING

Framer vs Durable: Two leaders, two different worlds. One for designers, one for businesses. Real comparison from hands-on testing.

THE FUNDAMENTAL DIFFERENCE

🎨 FRAMER: DESIGN-FIRST

Built for designers, agencies, portfolios. Figma-like interface, pixel-perfect control, stunning visual output.

  • • Target: Creative professionals, agencies, startups
  • • Strength: Visual design, animations, interactions
  • • Output: Portfolio sites, marketing pages, product showcases
  • • Learning curve: Moderate (design background helps)

💼 DURABLE: BUSINESS-FIRST

Built for local businesses, lead generation. AI generates business-ready sites with built-in CRM, SEO, integrations.

  • • Target: Local businesses, service providers, entrepreneurs
  • • Strength: Lead capture, business tools, integrations
  • • Output: Business sites, landing pages, lead funnels
  • • Learning curve: Minimal (business-focused)

HEAD-TO-HEAD COMPARISON

Feature Framer Durable Winner
Pricing (Entry) $5/mo $15/mo Framer
AI Generation Speed ~30s ~30s Tie
Code Export ✅ Yes (React) ❌ No Framer
E-commerce Basic (Snipcart) Built-in Durable
Design Flexibility Superior Template-based Framer
SEO Tools Strong Strong+ Durable
CRM/Lead Tools Basic Built-in Durable
Integrations Growing ecosystem Business-focused Durable
Template Variety 1,000+ ~50 (business) Framer
Learning Curve Moderate Minimal Durable
Vendor Lock-in ✅ Exportable ❌ Locked in Framer

REAL CASE STUDIES

DESIGN AGENCY: FRAMER

Challenge: Needed stunning portfolio to showcase visual work

Solution: Framer with custom animations, parallax, interactive galleries

Result: +300% portfolio views, 45% increase in client inquiries within 60 days

"Framer let us create a portfolio that matches our design vision. The code export means we're never locked in."

HVAC COMPANY: DURABLE

Challenge: Generate leads, show services, capture inquiries

Solution: Durable AI with CRM integration, quote request forms, service areas

Result: +180% qualified leads, 32% increase in service bookings in 90 days

"Durable gave us a complete business site with lead capture in 30 minutes. The CRM integration is game-changing."

DECISION FRAMEWORK

🎨 CHOOSE FRAMER IF:

  • ✓ You're a designer, creative, or agency
  • ✓ Visual design and aesthetics are critical
  • ✓ You need portfolio or marketing showcase sites
  • ✓ Code export capability is important (avoid lock-in)
  • ✓ You want maximum design flexibility
  • ✓ Budget is a consideration ($5/mo entry)
  • ✓ You have design skills or want to learn

💼 CHOOSE DURABLE IF:

  • ✓ You're a local business or service provider
  • ✓ Lead generation is your primary goal
  • ✓ You need business tools (CRM, invoicing, quotes)
  • ✓ You want minimal setup time (30 minutes)
  • ✓ You don't have design skills
  • ✓ E-commerce is important (built-in store)
  • ✓ You value business integrations over visual control

⚠️ BRUTAL HONESTY: CRITICAL DIFFERENCES

DURABLE LOCK-IN RISK

Durable has NO code export. You're locked into their platform forever. If price hikes, feature cuts, or business model changes occur, you lose everything. This is acceptable for some businesses, but understand the risk before committing.

FRAMER LEARNING CURVE

Framer rewards design skills. If you have zero design sense, Framer won't magically make you a great designer. The output quality depends on your input. Expect to spend time learning the interface and design principles.

BOTTOM LINE: Framer = Design freedom + no lock-in (but requires skills).
Durable = Business tools + speed (but locked in forever).
Choose based on your primary need: visual control (Framer) or business utility (Durable).
